verses.verse: (Comfort and Assurance in Godâ€™s Presence) A Psalm of David, when he was in the Wilderness of Judah. (Ps 42.2; 84.2) O God, you are my God; I seek you; my soul thirsts for you; my flesh faints for you, as in a dry and weary land where there is no water.
(Ps 27.4) So I have looked upon you in the sanctuary, beholding your power and glory.
(Ps 69.16) Because your steadfast love is better than life, my lips will praise you.
(Ps 28.2; 104.33) So I will bless you as long as I live; I will lift up my hands and call on your name.
(Ps 36.8; 71.23) My soul is satisfied as with a rich feast, (Heb with fat and fatness) and my mouth praises you with joyful lips
(Ps 42.8) when I think of you on my bed and meditate on you in the watches of the night,
(Ps 27.9) for you have been my help, and in the shadow of your wings I sing for joy.
(Ps 18.35) My soul clings to you; your right hand upholds me.
(Ps 40.14; 55.15) But those who seek to destroy my life shall go down into the depths of the earth;
they shall be given over to the power of the sword; they shall be prey for jackals.
(Deut 6.13; Ps 21.1; Isa 45.23) But the king shall rejoice in God; all who swear by him shall exult, for the mouths of liars will be stopped.
